website_summaries.verdict: For those who simply want a way to quickly check a car battery and don’t need marine or large vehicle options, this is an essential toolbox item.
pros: Specific to lead-acid automotive batteries, which keeps its functions simple and straightforward
Onboard display has easy to understand results
cons: 12V testing only, with a load limit of 16V

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, accurate battery tester
customer_reviews.text: Bought to test the battery and changing system in my Honda b/c it seemed the battery wasn't holding a charge. Sure enough, the battery died the day this item arrived. Tested the dead batter and it showed as bad. Tested its replacement when I picked it up from the store and it showed as good. Replaced my batter in the vehicle and then ran a crank and load test with the TT TOPDON AB101. Charing system is working well per the tool and haven't had any additional issues with my new battery since. Handy tool. Also tested our newer Subaru's battery and it shows as healthy as well.
customer_reviews.author: d3xt3r

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Couple of must have tools, particularly for RV and Boat owners. . A battery analyzer that can also check the Cranking System, the Charging System plus Battery Load tests and can also function as battery charger that can knock sulfate off the plates. That would be the Topdon AB 101. and for a smart battery charger the CTEC Multi US 7002 for regular 12v and 6v deep cycle lead-acid batteries like Trojan 105s..
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Money saved
customer_reviews.text: Last time I went to an auto repair shop. The mechanics told me that maybe I should consider replacing the original battery of my Ford. But I bought it just 4 years ago! So I searched on Amazon and chose this one. It’s portable of course, and the result could be presented directly. At first I liked to choose another brand since it was cheaper than this one, but the way it showed the result was a little bit confusing, at least for me. Luckily I decided to buy this brand eventually and it showed that the battery was in good condition. And I decided never to go to that auto repair shop again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Fundora

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Not very Acurate and is consistently diagnosing most battery’s as needing to be replaced even though the are semi new and working fine. I can’t honestly recommend this. One reason I got this is because I did need something like this and it was recommended by Scotty Kilmore on youtube. I usually respect his opinions but I don’t think it works accurately. Also In my professional opinion I don’t see how this could be accurate in starter test if it’s not connected in series when doing a starter test.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dirac

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if this unit is working correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Have tried the TOPDON 101 tester on three different vechicles. Everytime I checked with this unit said the battery needed to be replaced. Went to my Ford dealership with first car and they tested the car and all together different readings on their professional equipment. The second car was checked by an independent car repair garage with their equipment, again they came up with a different set of readings. All the batteries DID NOT NEED TO BE REPLACED, and charging systems were all fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D.

customer_reviews.title: Big Fail
customer_reviews.text: Tester arrived on time and in good shape. Display failed from time to time and was unreadable. Had to re run tests many times. Never could run the high RPM test since the unit began the test before I could move the throttle up. Waste of time and money. Sending back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Good tester but not sure of accuracy of all the test results
customer_reviews.text: Tried this tester on my truck with a good battery. If connections to battery are not sufficient, the tester instructs you to check connections. When I tested battery, all results were what I expected except SOC (state of charge). SOH (state of health) was 95%, voltage was good (12.4 VDC), CCA were 622 (rated at 650), but SOC (state of charge) was only 62% and said I should charge battery. This battery easily starts my truck & has a good charge so I'm not sure about this result. Nonetheless, I believe it is very useful, very easy to use and is a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Forget Using This to Check Battery Health
customer_reviews.text: Tested 4 brand new batteries and for 3 of the 4 it displayed "Replace." Ridiculous. I would not recommend this if checking battery health is important to you. Otherwise, easy to use and does do a good job of displaying accurate CCAs.
customer_reviews.author: JBHP

customer_reviews.title: SOLAR Battery Bank tester - Works well for finding bad cables
customer_reviews.text: After testing batteries and determining which one is dragging things down, I found this device to be invaluable in testing pre-made cables. Even those I made with brand new shiny copper connectors turned out to need work. Soldering seems the only way to go, on these, and you must clean the heck out of them, like you would with plumbing. They will be acceptable to this device, eventually it will pass them.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Thomas149

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, but accurate?
customer_reviews.text: Initially I have started using it w/o reading the instructions, and was a bit confused; perhaps better screen prompts/messages would fix this issue. Ultimately, I have read the (short, clear and to the point) instruction, and tested all three cars batteries. Peculiar thing is that two out of three have low cranking power, and the tool tells me to replace them soon. Now both of the cars (which are used) I have acquired in last two weeks, and there is a possibility that the batteries indeed need replacing, or the tool is bias toward replacing the batteries or less accurate. Ultimately, I would recommend this tester
customer_reviews.author: Zetis

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Easy to use, has a lot of features. Checks starting and charging systems as well. I checked some older batteries that are nearing the end of there useful life, that are still functioning. The tester recommended replacement. One is a 9 plus year old single AGM battery in a plow truck, the other is 5 year old battery in a car I owned 17yr. that the battery never lasted longer than 5 years. Will be interesting to see how much more use i get from these two before they die.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My motorcycle battery is very difficult to remove. It is tucked in below the seat and and I have to unhook tons of stuff just to remove and then put it back in. It is like 45 min worth of work. The issue is it was having trouble starting. With this I was able to unhook the battery and keep in on the bike and verify that it was not the battery. I replaced the starter and it started right up. Worth every penny. Tools like this are a necessity if you are doing home mechanic work.
customer_reviews.author: C-KicksXL

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Results
customer_reviews.text: I used this to test several batteries of various types, ages and conditions. It provided accurate results MOST of the time, but it tends to recommend replacing a battery when the battery is only discharged. It seems to work best when the battery has been recently used and/or charged. I'll try to provide a follow-up review after gaining additional experience with the device.
customer_reviews.author: JonDal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work like it should
customer_reviews.text: It's a handy gadget. I got it from watching scotty kilmer, but u can isolate the tests.. and u have to do battery test then crank test the alternator... Most of the time it won't read the crank test won't even start it.. so there for u can't do the alternator test. Great concept.. but until ur able to isolate which test u want to do... Or fix it so it actually does the full test ....it gets 3 *** .. I read the little booklet it comes with.. n it says nothing on why or if it doesn't cycle to the next test. Or what to do if it doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: DJ skills

customer_reviews.title: A Rustbelted Top Don, with a Slice of YouTube for your Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Learned of this device from the YouTube Channel "Rustbelt Mechanic." He featured a "Top 5 Tools on Amazon," list or something to that effect. The Top Don made the list. Wonderful product. I've accurately, and quickly tested 3 batteries today. The great thing was that I had an A+ battery, a midlife/requires-a-charge/out-of-vehicle battery, and a battery that was garbage. The instructions are clear, the packaging makes for a great protection during storage, and the price can't be beat. Thanks Top Don, and thanks Mr. Rustbelt.
customer_reviews.author: Pixel_Dust

customer_reviews.title: Battery tester
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use. Sometimes though as others have complained, I get inaccurate readings. Sometimes the battery will show replace. Then after a retest will show good. This has happened a few times to me so the accuracy is questionable. Note this was a brand new battery. I have many years working with batteries. You can't really made a mistake testing it. Almost all batteries are flooded unless you have a newer AGM battery. Then just pick the proper current & press ok
customer_reviews.author: luvpontiacs

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use. Provides important vehicle battery system and charging information. A great value!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a product that would help determine when the batteries in our cars were starting to lose their ability to perform to their specs before being stranded with a dead battery. I was also questioning whether a certain vehicles' charging system was performing correctly. There are numerous devices that do the exact same thing as this one, but I did my research, and this model was consistently on the top of the lists of best-reviewed battery/charging system testers and comes highly recommended from some very reputable professional mechanics. So far, it has performed as advertised. It's very simple to use and provides some very important vehicle battery system and charging information. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff DeVergilio

customer_reviews.title: Nice but could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. Two areas where it falls short are 1.) it needs a better rubberized housing. This item is used in garages and in areas where it is very likely to be dropped. It needs to be a more rugged item. And 2.) It needs approximately 12 foot cables. In order to use it to test the cranking amperage tests, you have to use 2 people and a second person may not always be available to crank the car.
customer_reviews.author: Shane C. Frith

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to test my own battery quickly and easily. The last battery I bought was 6 months ago, shortly after I received this tester. I have calendar reminders to test my battery every 6 months. I just tested it and the state of charge is almost 100% but the state of health is 20%. It says to replace it. I took it to AutoZone, but when they tested it, it said good battery. /confused
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Good value and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have another tester to compare it with, but I have a bad battery that I use as a capacitor for a janky 12 volt garage sound system and it verifies the CCA’s are shot out and the battery is “bad”. Good enough for me. The tester is straight forward and easy to use. Bonus is its power is sourced from the battery being tested. No additional batteries needed.
customer_reviews.author: jkb

customer_reviews.title: key pad non-responsive...unuseable test article
customer_reviews.text: Original & replacement units both demonstrated the same anomaly; i.e., the keypad interface was not responsive to user input. The unit would auto default to opening test menu mid-test and/or could not be advanced to the next test sequence. Occasionally, when the unit responded per the owners manual test sequence steps, the test values appeared to be accurate based on similar test equipment. I purchased the Foxwell BT-705 which performs as advertised and whose longer test cables allow the operator to conduct the test from within the vehicle cab...a bonus for cranking (starter) and charging (alternator) testing.
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The product didn't work out of the box. I'm mechanically and electronically inclined, so I'm comfortable its the product which is the problem. Tried car several batteries and followed instructions closely. Bought at recommendation of Scotty Kilmer at You Tube. Scotty should retract his recommendation. Cheap product and sometimes you get what you pay for, or even less! Moving along to a more reputable product, likely at a higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L

customer_reviews.title: Impressive array of information on battery status.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this in a video of battery testing and comparison, and I was very impressed. Although it seemed a little expensive I have come to realize that the information it provides will be extremely helpful and valuable. Auto batteries seem more expensive, and just don't last as well. This should at least give me data to make a decision on what I need to do to insure a reliable start.
customer_reviews.author: Robert in Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Seems to perform pretty accurately.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this calculates battery SOH State Of Health but overall is very easy to use. It accurately found that my Tundra alternator has low performance. It gave me time to replace the brushes before it failed. I've used it on a half dozen vehicles and a Peterbilt big rig. Still too short of a test period to decide if I trust it but seems to be accurate so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: dropped the ball
customer_reviews.text: it does the tests. but one problem you can not choose the test you want to do. for example in my case. i wanted to do alternator test. you have to do other 2 tests first battery and starter before doing the alternator test. you cannot choose the test you want to do. and cords to battery a little short. try the bt 100 same brand much better.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Mora Jr.

customer_reviews.title: If you buy used vehicles this is a must
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a easier higher quality tool for your vehicle than this I tested my vehicle every test this machine is capable of and I found my issue and I fixed it I personally could not be happier with this tool I buy used vehicles all the time this will save you time money and energy on a used vehicle need to know if something is wrong with it right from the get go
customer_reviews.author: truecamper22

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: A perfect tool to keep around to check the life of your battery and starter easy to use tells you if you should replace wen it gets low just something nice to have if your curious about ur battery life and good to use if u buy a used car or better yet a used battery if its low just take it back for another one lol
customer_reviews.author: josh morsching

customer_reviews.title: Not quality!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional tech trying to save some money and got this tester. I tested a battery on a 2019 new vehicle with 3000 miles and the tester failed the battery. Attempted the test 5 times and failed every time. It would not see the voltage drop of the crank test and could not even get to the charging test. Returned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and handy
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of hauling the bulky battery tester. This is just as accurate and has more features. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Chuy!

customer_reviews.title: a nice tester to check your cars battery and see if it needs replacing
customer_reviews.text: it seems to work well to test battery and charging system . the directions are not well written , typical terrible translation into english uses abreviations on screen and in instructions could be easier to follow steps . the steps on screen dont match what book says
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hill

customer_reviews.title: Handy, portable tool with one complaint.
customer_reviews.text: The biggest complaint that I have about this item is it cuts out sometimes and resets. If you’re in the middle of testing it sometimes cuts out and you have start over from the beginning. I’m not sure if it is because of something internal, like a short or something like that, or if it’s a connection problem. Otherwise it’s a handy tool to have. Easy to use. Like that I can test batteries, starters, and charging systems.
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: Does works well!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to test the battery in my 2014 Honda Civic LX sedan. When most people focus on how to deal with the vehicle emissions, I find it also important to maintenance the battery to avoid shortened battery life. This battery tester can help me test the health status of the battery and check if the cranking system and charging system works normally! You should get one!
customer_reviews.author: Harold Wonsley

customer_reviews.title: Seems great
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is the only battery tester I have so I can't compare it to another, It's easy to use and seems to do the job. I could, I suppose, go and have the batteries tested at NAPA and compare the results but I'm probably not going to do that. It came quickly, in good condition, and seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth h graham

customer_reviews.title: Great investigating tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. after having battery tested in my daughter in law mustang. Oriellys once, Walmart twice, that's where she originally bought the battery, said it was good. It was not. A two month old battery was bad. I tested it in front of them after they charged it. It said it was bad and to replace. I showed them the alternator was charging correctly. I showed the starter was okay. Without saying a word. He left and came back with a new battery. So after dealing with the problem for two weeks. It's fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This was for a friend. He took his vehicle to one dealer and was told he needed a new starter. Another dealer said he needed a new battery. This tester allowed my friend to determine he needed just a new battery.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I apologize for the overall 4-star rating, even though the feature ratings were all 5-star. This is because I have no other experience with other similar meters. This purchase was the result of advice from a You Tube mechanic. I wanted a means of testing a vehicle battery to discover when it was time to replace. Given my limited experience so far I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Light . Easy to carry. And pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like that its small and easy to hook up. Walks through different checks on the battery. Used on my cars and some work cars. Its not just a load tester but it works on pretty much all of the battery system.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Great little battery tester, I couldn't really judge if it was accurate until I had my findings confirmed by another source and my battery was in fact due to be replaced, glad I found out before my wife was stranded somewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Christian L

customer_reviews.title: Great diagnostic tool to have
customer_reviews.text: The tester is great, I used it to test the battery on my truck and suv. It appeared very accurate as I knew how old the battery’s were. It is also very helpful that is goes right in to testing the starter system automatically after testing the battery. Would recommend, easy to diagnostic tool
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tester.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to test the battery on my ride on lawn mower. Can be a little finicky to use but once you get the hang of it it works just fine. You can set it to the CCA your battery is and then test it from there in or out of the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Pross

customer_reviews.title: Only will complete battery test
customer_reviews.text: The unit only will complete the battery test (which was detailed). It would not move forward to the the cranking test and the charging test. I have tried four times. I have reviewed the instructions. That is another problem, to get it started on the battery test the included instructions are not correct, however, after a bit I found out how to activate the unit for the battery test. The next test, cranking, should start automatically when you start the car which leads to the last test. It does not. I will need to return it as my purchase was based on all 3 tests being available.
customer_reviews.author: TIM DUNHAM

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I own a few cars and this battery tester is a ideal solution for me to keep a eye on there battery levels on a weekly basis. With it being able to check the cars battery condition ,cold cranking amp. Happy with this tester
customer_reviews.author: DIEUjetaime

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Great for checking cranking amps, not so much for heavy plate golf cart batteries. A user might have to install some bolts on a side post battery, though. Great diagnostic tool. Have not used the charging test function.
customer_reviews.author: Ronb

customer_reviews.title: Technician tired of tracking a tester down
customer_reviews.text: So far so good used it for work today. I don't know what else to say right now. in time I'll get some starting and charging tests in and see how well it works/ holds up and I'll update my review. one thing I did notice is that the cables aren't replaceable so if you use it everyday for work when the cable starts to get corroded or bent to much you'll be buying another one but for the price I guess it doesn't really matter. Also it's nice and compact dosen't take much space
customer_reviews.author: spfccm

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Good price
customer_reviews.text: I saw this product being demonstrated on YouTube ChuckE2009 page. I thought I would give it a try for myself. I have had issues with batteries and Changing systems before. And I was tried of paying sky high shop fees and not knowing if I was being given the straight answer. This product is easy as it gets and its fairly priced. Everyone should have one in their tool box. You can do the diagnostics your self saving a lot of money. Anyone who works on their own equipment needs this tool. I would highly recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Scotty suggested this item to check batteries so I bought one. I am quite satisfied with my purchase. It confirms what the dealer mechanics told me. I had a bad battery. I replaced the battery before it stranded me. Well worth the purchase in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: D3

customer_reviews.title: Saved a trip to the auto parts store!
customer_reviews.text: This tester is great for a quick and easy battery test...kept me from having to take the battery out of the car and running over to the auto parts store only to find the battery is actually good, and the issue is with my starter. Highly recommended tool for all car and truck owners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST WORTHLESS--NOT RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: Kind of basic. Would probably be easier to use if the instructions weren't in Chinglish. Doesn't much more information than you can get from a standard multi-meter. Scotty (youtube) may like it, but I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Retired World Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate car battery tester!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for testing batteries. Very easy to use and has an instruction manual that will teach anyone how to use this product properly. I had my car battery tested at my dealership. When testing this product on my vehicle, the readings matched the numbers from my dealership. You can’t go wrong with this product. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says it does great price for a much-needed tool
customer_reviews.text: I got this to test my car battery health and to check to see if my alternator was working it tests both both are fine then I had it verified by someone else with different tools they were both fine it's reliable
customer_reviews.author: David Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money I paid
customer_reviews.text: I bought AB101 on Amazon because it is way too much for me to pay around $50 for just a battery test. So far so good. Its LCD display is bright, easy to read even in sunlight. And the buttons are easy to use with a solid feel when pressed. This item helps me analyze the health of the battery effectively and quickly so I am not gonna left stranded on the side of the road, trail or floating downwind. The data provided is simple to read, plus it comes with a cable to plug into a computer for printing findings if you choose to. I’m glad of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Jasso

customer_reviews.title: Compact and very easy to use!  If you can follow the prompts, you are good to go
customer_reviews.text: Very small and does what much larger more expensive testers do for a lot less money. It walks you through the steps so you run through 1 to all the tests for the battery and the alternator.
customer_reviews.author: Paul's Tool Review

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: This tester confirmed that my battery was going bad, to my surprise, in my 2004 Scion Xb. Due to being able to diagnose the issue (slow cranking), I had ample time to find a replacement, which is becoming difficult for a Scion. After a few attempts, it is easy to use, requires no internal battery, and has a good design. I found the cables to be adequately long as well.
customer_reviews.author: turkey

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% sure
customer_reviews.text: After checking four batteries in my vehicles, it reported to change three of them. The funny thing is I'm not having problems with any of them. It did report CCA and resistance, which I was mostly interested in. Therefore, this can be another tool to have in case you have doubts about a batteries absolute condition.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Weir

customer_reviews.title: Nice tester.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Field Service Tech so I use it for work & on my own vehicles. Gives me a voltage reading, state of health, state of charge & test the crancking & charging system. Let's me know if I need to recharge or replace the battery. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. It is a lot nicer than my cheap one with only lights on it. I tested it with a more expensive tester to make sure the results were the same and they were.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Tested 3 batteries. 2 indicated it needed to be replaced. One was from Walmart and was taken back and tested with their testing machine. It showed the same reading indicating replacement. Just in time for a full replacement.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Great Car Battery Tester
customer_reviews.text: I saw this used by Scotty Kilmer on YouTube. Great little unit that is packed with features for a low price. Now I can test my batteries in my vehicles and replace before I’m stranded!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great insights into car health
customer_reviews.text: This tester couldn't be easier to use. Bought this based upon the recommendation by YouTuber Scotty Kilmer- always has great advice and recommendations. Thanks to this tester I learned that my battery needs to be replaced and my starter is questionable. Alternator is strong though. Great to know! Great tool - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and has built in voltmeter
customer_reviews.text: Liked the ease of use although no instructions were included in the package. I tested the battery and charging system on my 2003 Chevy Silverado 1500.
customer_reviews.author: sid mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, thanks to Scotty’ you tube channel. Easy to use, easy to read, very quick test for battery, load test and alternator. Great buy for the test that it does. I know when to charge my battery— its state of health, its state of charge. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ROGER MADARANG

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work as promised
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a month or so and just used it today to figure out that my Mom's Rav4 battery was in a low State of charge. Worked as I expected. A very handy gizmo to have around. PS - I didn't read the directions, which I should probably do.
customer_reviews.author: CNY Karl

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husbands birthday recently. He says it's a good battery tester and very accurate. He loves his new automotive device and says it's " Handy to have."
customer_reviews.author: jzwilder

customer_reviews.title: Great little tester
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use battery tester. Can test and analyze battery health (life) as well as test in and out of vehicle. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Helmuth

customer_reviews.title: Must have for car owners!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to use, and tested against other devices and in my opinion and testing is the best buy for those who care about their cars and the reliability of it battery. Simply a must!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Clean and easy just the way I like it, First time I used it (I thought it might be a wire problem(short or corrosion) but this little gem told me it was the battery. It said replace, 52% degraded. Should have paid attention. Next day when I left work I had a dead battery. Live and learn. Also checks the alternator and charging system with car running. The whole process took 10 min. and that includes opening package and learning how to use it. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn Griffith

customer_reviews.title: so far great
customer_reviews.text: just got it and used it on 2 cars. 1 car all was good to go and the other car all was good except cold cranking amps were low.these were the results i expected based on the way the cars crank and drive. tested voltage against another meter and results were within 1/2 %. heck of a buy
customer_reviews.author: henry

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, provides useful battery health stats
customer_reviews.text: WORTH. Easy to use, I like all the readings it gives you, and Scotty Kilmer approves too.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Yun

customer_reviews.title: Best Battery tester right at home without going to autozone free test
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2015 Honda Fit with a starter problem and a 4 year old battery. My battery SOH @ 92% and SOC 87% good condition but probably another year to replace the battery since I live in Chicago IL with dead cold winter weather. It also checks my starter cranking test the results came out “LOW” I replace the starter and retested it and came to normal. Highly Recommend!! to all you home garage semi mechanics👍🏻

feature_bullets: 【Convenience and Professional】This car battery Tester is recommended by Scotty Kilmer and BestReviews.The Onboard display has easy to understand results. It can directly detect the battery data and give suggestions on whether to replace the battery. It also has a cranking test and charging system Tests that advise on repairing your circuit or buying a new battery.

【Wide Test Range】It can test 12V lead-acid batteries that are regular flooded, AGM flat plate, AGM spiral, or gel batteries, and covers most of the battery rating standards - CCA, BCI, CA, MCA, JIS, DIN, IEC, EN, SAE, GB standards, for cars, motorcycles, trucks, RVs, ATVs, SUVs, boats, yachts, mowers and even golf carts.

【Unparalleled User Experience】Compared to the traditional load battery testers (gauges), this car battery tester is much user-friendly as it’s equipped with a large easy-to-read TFT screen that has a blue backlight and contrast adjustment for direct and accurate test results reading in 3 seconds. English, Russian, Spanish, French, German, Italian is supported.

【Cranking & Charging System Test】It displays the test results (actual cranking voltage & cranking time) of the starter system in milliseconds to indicate if the cranking system is working properly. Also, the battery load tester can check the 12V charging system to ensure that the output voltage of the generator is in a regular condition, the rectifier diode is working fine, and the charging current is with the normal range.
